subject: Re: Hi, New Member from UK
author: ourobouros2k2
full_text:
Indeed, I am new to the box type method of itc, but the results I 
have been getting from the shack hack box cannot be denied. I will 
admit there is the possibility of audio paradolia and coincidence, 
but the results and the specific details and names I have been 
getting in direct answers to my questions are far to personal and 
accurate to be totally coincidence. I too noticed from my very first 
session that reviewing the recording brings out so much more detail. 
I was able to detect redundant answers to my questions in addition to 
the answers I heard live. Good stuff and best of luck.

thanks, 
Andy


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> 
> I find that i miss a lot in real-time when doing a session live.  
> That's why it's always good to record and review what you may have  
> missed.  I would love to hear your recordings and see what you've 
> been getting.  And you are using a mobile phone....that's 
> interesting.  That continues to prove that they will use anything 
we 
> have to communicate.
> 
> Good Job and continued success,
> -Steve H.
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "tonyandsue13" <tonyandsue13@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > Within the last week I came across the concept of the ghost box 
> > (Frank's box) and have had immediate results.
> > 
> > This is actually using a mobile phone on radio mode with a manual 
> scan, 
> > simply holding down the button and it scans through the FM bands 
> either 
> > up or down. There was no white noise being played at the same 
time 
> nor 
> > on review.
> > 
> > What surprised me was the clarity of the answers to direct 
> questions 
> > which could then be checked on a reviewing the tape. But also 
that 
> on 
> > one ocassion the replies weren't audible until the replay of the 
> taped 
> > session was heard.
> > 
> > Is this typical?
> > 
> > I can upload the sessions which are quite interesting due to the 
> > subject being discussed.
> >
>
